block.p: Begin to pot herbs for winter use: take divisions of chives and mint, and cuttings of woody herbs like rosemary and lemon verbena. If tender plants have outgrown their containers, replant in pots a size or two larger. Use the same type of potting mix. To keep the plant in the same pot, you can carefully trim roots by as much as 25 percent.

Begin to pot herbs for winter use: take divisions of chives and mint, and cuttings of woody herbs like rosemary and lemon verbena. If tender plants have outgrown their containers, replant in pots a size or two larger. Use the same type of potting mix. To keep the plant in the same pot, you can carefully trim roots by as much as 25 percent.

Apply organic mulch to cut late-season weed germination. Seeds of many weeds and self-seeding annuals go dormant over winter. Pull up annuals that have gone by, or cut off seed heads before they shatter.
